t: Isaiah 2
God’s Universal Reign
The*p word which Isaiah the son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem.

Now*pn it will come about that In*ln the last days The*ln mountain of the house of the Lord*s Will*ln be established as the chief of the mountains, And*ln will be raised above the hills; And*ln all the nations will stream to it.

And*ln many peoples will come and say, “Come,*ln let us go up to the mountain of the Lord,*s To*ln the house of the God of Jacob; That*ln He may teach us concerning His ways And*ln that we may walk in His paths.” For*ln the law will go forth from Zion And*ln the word of the Lord*s from Jerusalem.

And*ln He will judge between the nations, And*ln will render decisions for many peoples; And*ln they will hammer their swords into plowshares and their spears into pruning hooks. Nation*ln will not lift up sword against nation, And*ln never again will they learn war.
Come,*ln house of Jacob, and let us walk in the light of the Lord.*s

For*ln You have abandoned Your people, the house of Jacob, Because*ln they are filled with*i influences*i from the east, And*ln they*i are*i soothsayers like the Philistines, And*ln they strike bargains*i with the children of foreigners.
Their*ln land has also been filled with silver and gold And*ln there is no end to their treasures; Their*ln land has also been filled with horses And*ln there is no end to their chariots.
Their*ln land has also been filled with idols; They*ln worship the work of their hands, That*ln which their fingers have made.
So*ln the common*i man has been humbled And*ln the man of*i importance*i has been abased, But*ln do not forgive them.
Enter*ln the rock and hide in the dust From*ln the terror of the Lord*s and from the splendor of His majesty.
The*ln proud look of man will be abased And*ln the loftiness of man will be humbled, And*ln the Lord*s alone will be exalted in that day.
A Day of Reckoning Coming
For*pn the Lord*s of hosts will have a day of*i reckoning*i Against*ln everyone who is proud and lofty And*ln against everyone who is lifted up, That*ln he may be abased.
And*ln it*i will*i be*i against all the cedars of Lebanon that are lofty and lifted up, Against*ln all the oaks of Bashan,
Against*ln all the lofty mountains, Against*ln all the hills that are lifted up,
Against*ln every high tower, Against*ln every fortified wall,
Against*ln all the ships of Tarshish And*ln against all the beautiful craft.
The*ln pride of man will be humbled And*ln the loftiness of men will be abased; And*ln the Lord*s alone will be exalted in that day,
But*ln the idols will completely vanish.
Men*iln will go into caves of the rocks And*ln into holes of the ground Before*ln the terror of the Lord*s And*ln the splendor of His majesty, When*ln He arises to make the earth tremble.
In*ln that day men will cast away to the moles and the bats Their*ln idols of silver and their idols of gold, Which*ln they made for themselves to worship,
In*ln order to go into the caverns of the rocks and the clefts of the cliffs Before*ln the terror of the Lord*s and the splendor of His majesty, When*ln He arises to make the earth tremble.
Stop*ln regarding man, whose breath of*i life*i is in his nostrils; For*ln why should he be esteemed?
